title: The Quotient Rule for Simplifying Square Roots
text: The square root of the quotient $$\frac{a}{b}$$ is equal to the quotient of the square roots of a and $$b$$, where $$b \neq 0$$: $$\sqrt{\frac{a}{b}}=\frac{\sqrt{a}}{\sqrt{b}}$$
speech: The square root of the quotient  a over b,  is equal to the quotient of the square roots of a and  b , where  b is not equal to 0 : , the square root of a over b, end root is equal to fraction, the square root of a over, the square root of b

is equal to the quotient of the square roots of a and   b
, where   b is not equal to 0
:  , the square root of a over b, end root is equal to fraction, the square root of a over, the square root of b

title: The Quotient Rule for Simplifying Square Roots
text: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression: $$\sqrt{\frac{5}{36}}=\frac{\sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{36}}$$
speech: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression:  the square root of 5 over 36, end root is equal to fraction, the square root of 5 over, the square root of 36
pacedSpeech: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression:   the square root of 5 over 36, end root is equal to fraction, the square root of 5 over, the square root of 36

title: Principal Square Root
text: The principal square root of a is the nonnegative number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a. It is written as a radical expression, with a symbol called a radical over the term called the radicand: $$\sqrt{a}$$.
speech: The principal square root of a is the nonnegative number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a. It is written as a radical expression, with a symbol called a radical over the term called the radicand:  the square root of a .

title: Principal Square Root
text: What number multiplied by itself equals 36?
